questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about undo management in a RAC environment? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
ABE for sure

choices.C: An instance that performs instance recovery can write to the undo tablespace of a failed instance.
choices.E: It is necessary to assign a specific undo tablespace to a specific instance.
choices.A: You can dynamically assign a newly created undo tablespace to an instance.
choices.D: A mixture of automatic undo management and manual undo management is supported within a RAC database.
choices.B: In a policy-managed RAC database, an undo tablespace may automatically be created if OMF is enabled for the database.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
4 answers are true here. I think it's an old question because support for administrator-managed instance is added from 12.2 ( answer D).
In 19c BCDE are true

choices.E: It supports multiple databases assigned to the same server pool.
choices.B: It requires Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a Cluster to be installed and Clusterware to be running.
choices.C: A server pool can be managed by QoS even if it does have database instances running on any server in the pool.
choices.A: It can manage database services only if they are defined as UNIFORM services.
choices.D: Databases managed by QoS can be administrator managed or policy managed.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Quality of Service Management (QoS)? (Choose three.)

choices.E: acfsutil encr init is used to establish role separation between encryption managers and encryption auditors.
choices.D: acfsutil encr on can be used to specify the encryption key length for a directory or file.
choices.C: acfsutil encr off can be run by an encryption manager who may not have system administrator privileges.
choices.A: A copy of an encrypted file is not encrypted unless it is created in an encrypted directory.
choices.B: An ACFS snapshot can be ACFS encrypted.

discussion.content:
A. A copy of an encrypted file is not encrypted unless it is created in an encrypted directory.
B. An ACFS snapshot can be ACFS encrypted.
 
D. acfsutil encr on can be used to specify the encryption key length for a directory or file.

Selected Answer: BDE
Correct Statements:

B. ACFS snapshot can inherit encryption.

D. acfsutil encr on specifies encryption key length.

E. acfsutil encr init establishes role separation.

Incorrect Statements:

A. Copies of encrypted files remain encrypted.

C. acfsutil encr off needs admin privileges.

comments.content:
A: it dipends how it is copied: "A copy of a realm-protected file is not realm-protected unless the copy is made in a security realm-protected directory.

Some applications, such as the vi editor, re-create a file when the file is modified. The modified file is saved as a temporary file, the original file is removed, and temporary file is copied with the original file name as the destination name. This process creates a new file. If the new file is created in a realm-protected directory, the security policies of the realm also apply to the new file. If the new file is not created in a realm-protected directory, then the new file is not realm-protected. If you are planning to copy a realm-protected file, you should ensure that the parent directory is also security realm protected.

"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
E is wrong - there is no role separation with acfsutil encr init command.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about ASM Cloud File System (ACFS) encryption? (Choose three.)

choices.F: RAC databases have GRD cache resources distributed among all the database instances and stored in the large pool of each instance.
choices.C: Clustered ASM has GRD resources distributed among all ASM instances.
choices.E: All GRD Enqueue Resource master metadata is held in the shared pool of the same database instance.
choices.A: Only one GRD shadow resource may exist for an Enqueue Resource.
choices.D: All GRD Enqueue Resource master metadata is held in the large pool of the same database instance.
choices.B: Shadow GRD resources may exist in more than one database instance for a resource.
choices.G: RAC databases have GRD cache resources distributed among all the database instances and stored in the shared pool of each instance.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about the Global Resource Directory (GRD) in Oracle 19c RAC database and in Clustered ASM? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCG
Correct Statements
B: Shadow GRD resources may exist in multiple database instances for a resource.
C: GRD resources in Clustered ASM are distributed among all ASM instances.
G: GRD cache resources in RAC databases are stored in the shared pool of each instance.
Incorrect Statements
A: Incorrect because there can be multiple GRD shadow resources for an Enqueue Resource.
D: Incorrect because GRD metadata is not held in the large pool.
E: Incorrect because GRD metadata is not held in the shared pool of just one instance.
F: Incorrect because GRD cache resources are not stored in the large pool.

Selected Answer: BCG
BCG is correct

Selected Answer: BCG
F is wrog

Selected Answer: AB
A: true, although it is better to say LOAD_BALANCE=on
B: true
C: false, basdon goal, not always the fastest
D: false, Instead, client-side connect time load balancing occurs when the client attempts to connect to a listener, and Oracle Net randomly chooses a listener from the tnsnames.ora entry
E: false, the description is server-side Load-Balancing

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about load balancing using a database service in a RAC environment? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Client-side connect time load balancing works only if it uses a tnsnames entry specifying LOAD_BALANCE=yes.
choices.C: Server-side load balancing connections are always distributed across instances based on the fastest response time for the service.
choices.D: Client-side connect time load balancing is done at the time of the initial connection attempt to the database service.
choices.B: Server-side connect time load balancing is done at the time of the initial connection attempt to the database service.
choices.E: In client-side load balancing, the SCAN listener uses the Load Balancing Advisory to direct a connection request to the least loaded instance hosting the service.
